result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Nathan D. Weingandt in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Upon motion of the State case is dismissed and read-in. Minutes filed.

Defendant Nathan D. Weingandt in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Valerian A. Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Nathan D. Weingandt in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Haley J Rea and intern Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed. Preliminary hearing requested within time period.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND: 14CF255 AND 14CM178. Defendant must reside at 115 N Broad Street, Elkhorn, WI.   Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH G.D. NO CONTACT WITH CHATEAU ROYALE IN LAKE GENEVA OR ITS EMPLOYEES OR ITS GUESTS.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant appears in courtm in custody, with attorney Rebecca Hammock. Cody Horlacher appears for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes field.
